User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the captive portal system.

email.description: The email address of the user.

registrationDate.description: The date and time the user registered.

Ad.title: Ad
Ad.description: Represents an advertisement displayed in the captive portal.

advertiserId.description: Reference to the Advertiser. (Relationship: Advertiser 1:N Ad)

imageUrl.description: URL of the image for the advertisement.

videoUrl.description: URL of the video for the advertisement.

clickUrl.description: URL to redirect to when the ad is clicked.

startDate.description: The date and time the advertisement starts being displayed.

endDate.description: The date and time the advertisement stops being displayed.

bidPrice.description: The bid price for the advertisement (cost per click).

Advertiser.title: Advertiser
Advertiser.description: Represents an advertiser who places ads in the captive portal.

name.description: The name of the advertising company.

contactEmail.description: The contact email address for the advertiser.

paymentInformation.description: Payment details for the advertiser. Consider storing only a reference to payment details rather than the actual details for security.

ClickEvent.title: ClickEvent
ClickEvent.description: Represents a click event on an advertisement.

id.description: Unique identifier for the click event.

adId.description: Reference to the Ad. (Relationship: Ad 1:N ClickEvent)

userId.description: Reference to the User. (Relationship: User 1:N ClickEvent)

timestamp.description: The date and time the click event occurred.

ipAddress.description: The IP address of the user who clicked the ad.

definition.description: Stores click event data for each ad. Includes denormalized 'userId' for authorization independence.

params.name: adId
params.description: The unique identifier of the advertisement.

params.name: clickEventId
params.description: The unique identifier of the click event.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to ensure authorization independence, clarity, and scalability. User data is stored under `/users/{userId}`, providing a clear ownership model. Advertisers and Ads are separated into their own collections (`/advertisers` and `/ads`) to avoid mixing data with different access requirements, which aligns with the Structural Segregation principle. Click events, which are tied to both Ads and Users, are stored in a subcollection `/ads/{adId}/clickEvents/{clickEventId}` and also include denormalized `userId` for efficient querying. This setup facilitates secure list operations (QAPs) and avoids the need for complex filtering in rules. By including `userId` in the ClickEvent, it enables independent authorization without relying on parent document data, achieving Authorization Independence.
